15/*! \file */
16
17#include <config.h>
18
19#include <ctype.h>
20#include <errno.h>
21#include <limits.h>
22#include <inttypes.h>
23#include <stdlib.h>
24
25#include <isc/parseint.h>
26#include <isc/result.h>
27
28isc_result_t
29isc_parse_uint32(uint32_t *uip, const char *string, int base) {
30 unsigned long n;
31 uint32_t r;
32 char *e;
33 if (! isalnum((unsigned char)(string[0])))
34 return (ISC_R_BADNUMBER);
35 errno = 0;
36 n = strtoul(string, &e, base);
37 if (*e != '\0')
38 return (ISC_R_BADNUMBER);
39 /*
40 * Where long is 64 bits we need to convert to 32 bits then test for
41 * equality. This is a no-op on 32 bit machines and a good compiler
42 * will optimise it away.
43 */
44 r = (uint32_t)n;
45 if ((n == ULONG_MAX && errno == ERANGE) || (n != (unsigned long)r))
46 return (ISC_R_RANGE);
47 *uip = r;
48 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
49}
50
51isc_result_t
52isc_parse_uint16(uint16_t *uip, const char *string, int base) {
53 uint32_t val;
54 isc_result_t result;
55 result = isc_parse_uint32(&val, string, base);
56 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
57 return (result);
58 if (val > 0xFFFF)
59 return (ISC_R_RANGE);
60 *uip = (uint16_t) val;
61 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
62}
63
64isc_result_t
65isc_parse_uint8(uint8_t *uip, const char *string, int base) {
66 uint32_t val;
67 isc_result_t result;
68 result = isc_parse_uint32(&val, string, base);
69 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
70 return (result);
71 if (val > 0xFF)
72 return (ISC_R_RANGE);
73 *uip = (uint8_t) val;
74 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
75}
